intro: Kyllinga triceps, commonly known as swamp spikerush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in the Americas. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant features triangular stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that produce tiny flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in dense clusters. Kyllinga triceps plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic organisms.
